title: Looking at the wild
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Western Australia - Description and travel
Education, Instruction, Teaching & Schools/Outdoor recreation - Safety measures
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/National parks and reserves - Australia
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Natural areas - Australia

Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Environmental education
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Survival and emergency equipment
description: Harry Butler shows aspiring naturalists some of the simpler but fundamental techniques necessary to enjoy more fully a natural bush environment. Harry comments on the dress and basic equipment; demonstrates simple pit-traps and more complex fauna traps; and stresses the need for interest and enquiry in the natural bush environment.
